intro: Adenocalymma auristellae, commonly known as the golden sand mat, is a small, low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit with small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, adding a vibrant touch to its sandy or rocky habitat. Its succulent leaves help it retain moisture in dry conditions, making it well adapted to its environment. Adenocalymma auristellae is often found in coastal and inland dunes, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
